TextView.android:text: Shakib Al Hasan is a Bangladeshi international cricketer. Regarded as the greatest all-rounder of all time, his aggressive left-handed batting style in the middle order, controlled slow left-arm orthodox bowling has made him a consistent player for Bangladesh. Born: March 24, 1987 (age 34 years), Magura District. Spouse: Umme Ahmed Shishir (m. 2012) Salary: 425,000 USD (2011) Children: Alaina Hasan Abri, Errum Hasan, Eyzah Al Hasan Current teams: Bangladesh national cricket team (All-rounder) Siblings: Jannatul Ferdous Ritu

Mohammad Mahmudullah, also known as Riyad, is a Bangladeshi cricketer and the current T20I captain. He has played First-class and List A cricket for Dhaka Division and has represented Bangladesh in all forms of the game. An all-rounder, he is a lower or middle-order batsman as well as an off spin bowler. Born: February 4, 1986 (age 35 years), Mymensingh. Height: 1.8 m Spouse: Jannatul Kawsar Mishti (m. 2011) Education: Mymensingh Zilla School Batting style: Right-handed Parents: Mohammad Obaidullah Nabab, Arafat Begum Dates joined: 2019 (Chattogram Challengers)

Mushfiqur Rahim is a Bangladeshi cricketer and the former captain and vice-captain of the Bangladesh national cricket team. He is considered as the best and most successful captain of Bangladesh in tests. Born: May 9, 1987 (age 34 years), Bogura Height: 1.6 m Spouse: Jannatul Kifayet Mondi (m. 2014) Children: Mohammad Shahroj Rahim Mayan Education: Bangladesh Krira Shikkha Protishtan, Jahangirnagar University, Bogura Zilla School Dates joined: 2020 (Beximco Dhaka), Parents: Mahbub Habib, Rahima Khatun

Liton Kumar Das is a Bangladeshi cricketer. He is a right-handed opening batsman and a test wicket-keeper. He made his international debut for Bangladesh in June 2015. He has scored the highest individual score for Bangladesh in ODI cricket. Born: October 13, 1994 (age 27 years), Dinajpur. Full name: Liton Kumar Das Nationality: Bangladeshi Height: 5 ft 7 in (1.70 m) Batting style: Right-handed Current teams: Bangladesh national cricket team (Wicket-keeper) Dates joined: November 2019 (Rajshahi Royals)

Mashrafe Bin Mortaza is a Bangladeshi international cricketer and politician who is the former captain in all three formats of the game for the Bangladesh national cricket team. Born: October 5, 1983 (age 38 years), Narail District. Height: 1.85 m Career start: 2001 Spouse: Sumona Haque Sumi (m. 2006) Education: Jahangirnagar University (2003–2004) Children: Sahil Mortaza, Humaira Mortaza Parents: Golam Mortaza, Hamida Mortaza

Tamim Iqbal Khan, more popularly known as Tamim Iqbal, is a Bangladeshi international cricketer. He is currently the captain of the Bangladesh national team in One Day Internationals. Tamim made his ODI debut in 2007 and played his first Test match the following year. Born: March 20, 1989 (age 32 years), Chattogram. Height: 1.75 m Career start: February 12, 2005 Spouse: Ayesha Siddiqa (m. 2013) Children: Arham Iqbal Khan Siblings: Nafees Iqbal, Urusha Khan Current teams: Bangladesh national cricket team (Batsman)

Mohammad Sabbir Rahman is a Bangladeshi cricketer. He is from Rajshahi and besides the national team, he plays for Rajshahi Division. He is an all-rounder: a right-handed batsman and legbreak bowler. He captained the Bangladesh Under 19's team. He made his international debut for Bangladesh in February 2014. Born: November 22, 1991 (age 29 years), Rajshahi. Full name: Mohammad Sabbir Rahman. Batting style: Right-handed. Education: American International University-Bangladesh (AIUB). Parents: Hazera Khatun, Khaja Ahmed. Current teams: Bangladesh national cricket team (All-rounder). Dates joined: 2018 (Peshawar Zalmi)

Soumya Sarkar is a Bangladeshi cricketer. He is a left-handed batsman and a right arm medium-fast bowler who mainly plays as an opening batsman. Born: February 25, 1993 (age 28 years), Satkhira District Height: 1.83 m Batting style: Left-handed Education: Bangladesh Krira Shikkha Protishtan Siblings: Pushpen Sarkar Dates joined: 2020 (Central Zone cricket team), MORE Current teams: Bangladesh national cricket team (All-rounder)

Mosaddek Hossain Saikat is a Bangladeshi cricketer who plays for the Bangladesh national cricket team and for Barisal Division in domestic cricket. He made his international debut for Bangladesh in January 2016. Born: December 10, 1995 (age 25 years), Mymensingh Height: 1.74 m Spouse: Samia Sharmin Usha (m. 2012–2018) Batting style: Right-handed Siblings: Mosabbek Hossain Parents: Hosne Ara Begum, Abul Kashem Current teams: Abahani Limited cricket team (Batsman)

Mohammad Mithun is a Bangladeshi cricketer. He made his first class in 2006/07 season for Sylhet Division. He plays for Sylhet Thunder in the Bangladesh Premier League. He made his international debut for Bangladesh in February 2014. Born: March 2, 1991 (age 30 years), Kushtia Height: 1.78 m Batting style: Right-handed Number of centuries: 0 Current teams: Prime Bank Cricket Club (Wicket-keeper), MORE Dates joined: 2019 (Sylhet Thunder), 2018 (Kandahar Knights)

Mustafizur Rahman, also known as The Fizz, is a Bangladeshi international cricketer. He is specialized as a left-arm fast-medium bowler. He has taken the most wickets in a debut One Day International series. He is the first player to win the ‘Man of the Match’ award on both Test as well as ODI debuts. Born: September 6, 1995 (age 26 years), Satkhira District Height: 1.8 m Bowling: Left-arm Fast medium ODI debut (cap 118): 18 June 2015 v India Test debut (cap 78): 21 July 2015 v South Africa Siblings: Mokhlesur Rahman Parents: Mahmuda Khatun, Abul Qasem Gazi

Mohammad Rubel Hossain is a Bangladeshi cricketer. Rubel made his international debut for Bangladesh in January 2009. A quick bowler with a slingy action similar to Lasith Malinga's- he also innovates a technique of delivery named 'Butterfly'. Born: January 1, 1990 (age 31 years), Bagerhat District Height: 1.8 m Spouse: Ishrat Jahan Dola (m. 2016) Bowling: Right arm fast medium Parents: Siddikur Rahman Batting: Right-handed Last Test: 7 February 2020 v Pakistan

Abu Jayed Chowdhury Rahi is a Bangladeshi cricketer who plays for Sylhet Division. He made his international debut for the Bangladesh cricket team in February 2018. In April 2019, he was named in Bangladesh's One Day International squad for the 2019 Cricket World Cup, despite being uncapped in an ODI match. Born: August 2, 1993 (age 28 years), Bangladesh Bowling: Right-arm medium-fast Last Test: 29 April 2021 v Sri Lanka Last ODI: 15 May 2019 v Ireland Test debut (cap 88): 4 July 2018 v Pakistan Last T20I: 7 June 2018 v Bangladesh National side: Bangladesh (2018–present)
